seg.output:
Grace and peace from God the Father and Lord Jesus Christ. I have eternal gratitude for your kind letters to the ministers of Bern and for your care for my well-being, Henry, most humane. You did much for me while I was in Bremgarten with you, and the greatest of all; what gifts of sacred letters did you not give me? What salutations did you not address to me while walking? What repasts in your houses did you not provide for me? What honors did you not bestow upon me? Finally, your kind greetings towards me, although not in writing, could not be contained. Such things will never be forgotten.
Also, to make you more aware of my situation, know that I am still living in Zofingen, teaching the German language, and for a while, I serve the ministers of the gospel in the town and around me with the Word of God, just like when I was with you.
My wife is close to giving birth, I have four daughters, and little food, and practically no burden to work or make money. Yet, help from the Lord and a strong hope in God, which has wonderfully sustained me and my household. The Lords of Bern have commanded me to stay in Zofingen to wait, etc. Therefore, I ask for your remembered friendship and I do not doubt that you will be an instrument of God to aid me and mine when it is convenient.

seg.output:
My wife, who is soon to give birth, has four daughters, a meagre income and almost no burden to work or make a profit. Yet, I have had help from the Lord and the strongest hope in God, who has miraculously provided for me and my household. The lords of Bern have ordered me to stay in Zofingen and wait, etc. So, mindful of our mutual friendship, I earnestly request your kindness, confident that you will be a tool of God in my and my family’s assistance, if it is convenient and possible. As for what you have encouraged me to do through certain messengers, namely Sebastian the Steward and Johann Bryttnow, it shall be done, God willing, at your expense this autumn or whenever you ask for it in your letter. Very soon I will be at your service, Guͤtschenckel, and at your wife Fenderli’s service.
Furthermore, I ask that you send greetings to your most beloved Pęnolopen [!], Syrene, that old Greek, the wild boar hunter, the bird catcher, the fish killer, your beloved and most sweet mother, Lord Wernher Steyner, the city’s prothonotary, Jacob Funck, and your entire family.
Farewell and keep me in your thoughts. Again, farewell.
Written quickly from Zofingen, 21st day of August, in the year of our Saviour etc. 32.
Your humble servant
George Cardelius of Eripolis.
Write to me often so that I have a reason to write to you.
To the venerable and faithful M. Heinrich Bullero [!], clergyman of Zurich, most deserving of his teacher’s respect etc.

Peace and grace to you from God the Father and Lord Jesus Christ. I am grateful and will always be eternally grateful to you, Henry, for so kindly attending to the ministers of Bern and my own interests in your letters. You showed me much kindness when I was in Bremgarten with you, and the greatest kindness of all. What gifts of sacred letters did you not give me? What greetings did you not give me as we walked together? What refreshment did you not provide for me in your homes? What honors did you not bestow upon me? Finally, you could not keep your mind from me with your greetings, although not with letters. I will never forget all these things.
Also, to let you know about my situation, I am still living in Zofingen, teaching the local language, and serving the ministers of the Gospel in the town and around me with the Word of God, as I used to do with you.
My wife is about to give birth to four daughters, we have very little food, and there is no work to be done or money to be earned. Nevertheless, I have received help from the Lord and a strong hope in God, who has miraculously sustained me and my family so far. The lords of Bern have commanded me to stay in Zofingen and wait, etc. Therefore, I request your kindness, in memory of our mutual friendship, and I am sure you will be a tool of God to help me and mine when it is feasible.
